intro: Hieracium sublividorubens, commonly known as the red-stemmed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy, reddish stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and it produces small, oval achenes as fruits. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
